column1: A GUN IN THE RIGHT PLACE
column3:
You spot a ranged weapon useful to the action.
Describe it; GM has veto over your description.
The weapon adds +1 dice so long as it's useful and intact.
If the GM is particularly pleased by your description,
it adds +2 dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
THEY SHOULDN T JUST LEAVE THESE THINGS LIYING AROUND'

You improvise a melee weapon out of something mundane.
Describe what you find; GM has veto over your description.
The weapon adds +1 dice so long as it's useful and intact.
If the GM is particularly pleased by your description,
it adds +2 dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
'IN THE RIGHT HANDS ANYTHING CAN BE A WEAPON. EVEN THIS CAKE.'

Play after a target has rolled but before the GM describes
the outcome. Add 1 to the target's score. Describe something
that helps them out. GM has veto over your description.
'THAT WAS LUCKY! AND UNEXPECTEDLY SANGUINOUS TOO.'

The attack strikes your target in a very painful area but
the effects aren't permanent. Roll a die; if the target
is an NPC, they're out of action for that many rounds.
If they're a PC, they're out of action for half that many rounds (rounding up).
'SMALL TARGET, BIG EFFECT.'
An object is damaged as a side-effect of the action. Try to persuade your GM what was damaged and see if they listen to you. Good luck.\nDO YOU RECKON WE NEEDED THIS STEERING WHEEL TO BE ATTACHED?'
EVERYTHING HASGONE WRONG!\nGM, pull out the thumbscrews.\nHONESTLY, I'M KIND OF IMPRESSED HOW BADLY THIS TURNED OUT.'

Pick another Troubleshooter. They can attack the
same target as you immediately (and it doesn't count
as taking their turn) at +1 or they can attack YOU
immediately at +1. Their choice.
'COME ON, WITH ME! NO - I MEAN, IN FRONT OF ME!'
SNATCHING DEFEAT FROM THE CLAWS OF VICTORY'\nSOMETHING GOES VERY WRONG!\nGM, you determine how.
'BETTER LUCKY THAN GOOD'\nSOMETHING GOES WAY BETTER THAN EXPECTED!\nGM, time to shine.

Play after a target has rolled but before the GM
describes the outcome. The target fumbles and drops
one piece of equipment they were holding in their
hands. Try to persuade your GM what you want it to
be and see if they listen to you.
'WHY DO THEY MAKE THESE HANDLES SO SLIPPERY?'

Play on any face-up card on the table. That card is
placed at the bottom of its respective deck; whatever
its in-game effects were, they no longer apply.
Describe what happened to cause this turn of events.
THAT THING YOU TOLD US WOULD SAVE US? NOT SO MUCH.

You spot a tool that's useful to the action. Describe it; GM has
veto over your description. The tool adds +1 dice so long as
it's useful and intact. If the GM is particularly pleased by your
description, it adds +2 dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
HAND ME A HAMMER. YES, ANOTHER HAMMER! THE COMPUTER GAVE
US TWO HANDS FOR A REASON, DIDN'T IT?

You spot a situation that you can exploit to confuse an
enemy. Describe what it is, then roll Chutzpah + Bluff to
take advantage. If you succeed, describe the actions
of that enemy. The GM has veto over your description,
so don't go crazy.
'YOU GO LEFT, I GO RIGHT AND WE LEAVE HIM HOLDING THE BAG.
WAIT, NO: WE KILL HIM. SORRY, GOT MIXED UP THERE.'

Play on a target just as you or another PC is about
to roll to attack them. If the roll is successful then the
wound causes the target to lose a limb.
'T IS BUT A SCRATCH'

Describe a group of NPCs who are useful to the action
OR detrimental to the action, your choice; GM has
veto over your description and controls the NPCs after
this round ends.
'LISTEN UP, YOU INFRARED SCREWHEADS! I'M PROMOTING YOU ALL TO
ABLATIVE STATUS!'

Invent a decorative terrain feature (a screen, banner, statue
and so on) that's useful to the action; GM has veto over your
creation. The feature adds +1 dice so long as the target uses
it. If the GM is particularly pleased by your description, it adds
+2 dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
'TURN THE VOLUME UP - I LOVE THIS SHOW! AND, UH, IT'LL ACT AS ADISTRACTION, TOTALLY.'

Everything goes right, above and beyond even the
greatest expectations, for a few seconds at least. GM
describes how.
'PEOPLE ARE GOING TO THINK WE CHEATED.'

You act immediately, interrupting the target's action.
If they survive then they can resolve their action after
you're finished.
'THERE ARE TWO KINDS OF CLONES: THE QUICK AND THE DEAD. AND I GUESS
MAYBE QUICK DEAD CLONES IF THERE'S AN ACCIDENT AT THE TRANSBOT
STATION BUT I DIGRESS: I M GOING TO SHOOT YOU.'

Draw three Action Cards. Choose one. Pass another to
a player of your choice. Place the third on the bottom
of the deck.
'MORE HASTE, LESS SPEED!'

Declare your action but before you roll, draw a card
from the action card deck and add its effects to what
you're doing.
'OF COURSE YOU HAVE NO IDEA WHAT I M DOING. I HAVE NO IDEA
WHAT I M DOING.'

You find a piece of armour or clothing that's helpful to
your current situation. Describe what you find; GM has veto
over your description. The item adds +1 dice so long as it's
useful and intact. If the GM is particularly pleased by your
description, it adds +2 dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
'IT S NOT A BUCKET, IT'S A HELMET. BUCKETS HAVE FEWER HOLES.'

The target's weapon jams. OR: The scene somehow
now involves jam but the target's weapon is perfectly
functional. Your choice.
'THESE OLD MODELS WILL BREAK AT THE DROP OF A HAT. DID YOU
DROP A HAT ON IT?'

Instead of hitting its target, a ranged attack (or
another appropriate action if you think you can get
away with it) hits something nearby that blows up with
a 3-metre blast radius. Describe what it is. GM has veto
over your description.
WHY DO WE KEEP ALL THESE RED BARRELS AROUND?'

You find a hiding spot; describe it. You can
Dodge any attacks until the start of the next
round but you cannot do anything else till then.
CALM BLUE RESERVOIR TANK, CALM BLUE RESERV- SORRY, CALM RED
RESERVOIR TANK, CALM RED RESERVOIR TANK...'

Play after an attack that causes damage; it
now causes no damage and instead destroys a
piece of equipment carried by the target. The
GM picks which.
'GOOD THING MY GRENADE STOPPED THAT BULLET! WHY ARE YOU
GUYS RUNNING?'

column1: MAN, AM I PLEASED TO SEE YOU
column3:

action OR detrimental to the action, your choice;
GM has veto over your description and controls the
NPC after the end of the round. The NPC gives +1/-1
dice so long as they're useful/impeding. If the GM is
particularly pleased by your description, they give +2/-
2 dice this round and +1/-1 dice thereafter.
'HEY, BUDDY, I NEED A HAND! OR A LEG. ANY LIMBS YOU HAVE
SPARE, REALLY.'

Describe a female-identifying NPC who's useful to
the action OR detrimental to the action, your choice.
GM has veto over your description and controls the
NPC after the end of the round. The NPC gives +1/-1
dice so long as they're useful/impeding. If the GM is
particularly pleased by your description, they give +2/-
2 dice this round and +1/-1 dice thereafter.
WHAT'S A NICE GIRL LIKE YOU DOING POINTING A GRENADE AT ME
LIKE THAT?'

As far as everyone (including the Computer) is
concerned, the target didn't perform that action;
someone else did. Try to persuade your GM who
you want it to be and see if they listen to you.
'I DIDN T SHOOT ANYONE! I'M NOT EVEN HERE!'

Describe a convenient terrain feature (a crane, vent,
steam pipe and so on) that's useful to the action.
GM has veto over your description. The feature adds
+1 dice so long as the target uses it. If the GM is
particularly pleased by your description, it adds +2
dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
I NEVER FIGURED OUT WHY THEY MADE AIR VENTS BIG ENOUGH FOR
CLONES. THEY JUST HAVE TO BE BIG ENOUGH FOR AIR, RIGHT?'

Play after a target has rolled but before the
GM describes the outcome. Delete 1 success
roll from the target's total. Describe something
unexpected that hindered them. GM has veto
over your description.
YOU GAVE IT YOUR BEST SHOT. NOW I'M GIVING IT BACK.

It's not that everything goes wrong with the
action, more that the exact opposite of what
the target wanted to happen happens instead.
GM, get creative.
WE CALL IT "POLARITY HILARITY."

You realise that this dangerous situation calls
for an unusual application of your skills.
Make an attack but pick a non-standard Stat and Skill
combination then persuade the GM why they're applicable in this
particular situation (GM, be lenient). If they buy it, you get +2 successes.
If they don't, -1 success.
WHO KNEW THAT BUREAUCRATS COULD BE SO DEADLY WITH A PAPERCLIP?

Describe how the action becomes dangerous.
You get +2 dice to any action but for every 1
rolled on a non-Computer dice, take 1 severity
of wound. So on 1, you're Hurt. On 2, you're
Injured and so on.
LOOKS LIKE THIS JUST GOT DANGEROUS. DANGEROUSLY EFFECTIVE!
THOUGH MOSTLY JUST DANGEROUS.

Describe how the action becomes dangerous.
+2 dice to any action but for every 1 rolled
on a non-Computer dice, take 1 severity of
wound. So on 1, you're Hurt. On 2, you're
Injured, and so on.
I LL RISK IT FOR A BISCUIT. MAYBE TWO BISCUITS.

You notice a piece of safety equipment that's useful
to the action; GM has veto over your description. The
item adds +1 dice so long as it's useful and intact. If
the GM is particularly pleased by your description, it
adds +2 dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
WHO KNEW THAT TRAFFIC CONES WERE SO… IMPALEY?

Play on an attack that causes damage. Now it
causes no damage and instead the attacker
loses a point of Moxie because they were
convinced they'd hit and now they didn't and
they're a bit freaked out.
THAT WAS TOO CLOSE, MAN! I'M FREAKIN' OUT, MAN!

Play after someone has rolled but before the
GM describes the outcome. Subtract 1 success
from the roll. Describe something that hindered
them. GM has veto over your description.
THERE'S ALWAYS SOMETHING, ISN'T THERE?

Play this card at the start of the round to go first
but deduct one dice from any roll you make
this round. If another player also plays 'Snap
Decision' they cancel each other out and
neither PC gets an action this round.
THINKING'S FOR CHUMPS.

Play this card at the start of the round to go first
but deduct one dice from any roll you make
this round. If another player also plays 'Snap
Decision' they cancel each other out and
neither PC gets an action this round.
THINKING'S FOR CHUMPS.

You spot an enemy who is unaware of your
presence. Make an attack at +2 to your NODE
but swap Violence for Chutzpah, Stealth for
Melee or both.
QUICK, WHILE HE S LAUGHING TOO HARD TO NOTICE US.

If the action you're playing this card on
causes damage to a living thing or a bot, it
automatically kills whatever got hit. Describe the
death. GM has veto over your description.
YOU'D BE SURPRISED HOW EASILY A HUMAN BEING'S HEAD WILL
COME OFF.

You spot a hand-to-hand weapon useful to the action.
Describe it; GM has veto over your description. The
weapon adds +1 dice so long as it's useful and intact.
If the GM is particularly pleased by your description, it
adds +2 dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
HEY, TURNS OUT I HAD A KNIFE IN MY BACK ALL ALONG! WONDER
HOW THAT GOT THERE?

Describe a bot or AI who's useful to the action OR
detrimental to the action, your choice. GM has veto
over your description. The NPC gives +1/-1 dice so long
as they're useful/impeding. If the GM is particularly
pleased by your description, they give +2/-2 dice this
round and +1/-1 dice thereafter.
BOTS - IS THERE ANYTHING THEY CAN T DO? EXCEPT - Y'KNOW - WHAT
WE TELL EM TO DO?

You realise something of vital importance. Say what
it is, then make an appropriate Brains + a relevant
skill check. If you succeed, everyone you choose
(including yourself) is at +1 dice next turn so long as
they heed your advice. If you fail, everyone (including
yourself) is at -1 dice.

rest of the rounds to prepare your action. It happens
last in the round but you get +2 dice to roll. If both
Take Your Time cards are played in the same round,

A vehicle appears that's useful to the action. Describe
it; GM has veto over your description. The vehicle adds
+1 dice to rolls so long as it's useful and intact. If the
GM is particularly pleased by your description, it adds
+2 dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
GET IN - THERE'S NO TIME TO EXPLAIN!

Describe an elevated terrain feature (a lift, gantry,
some stairs and so on) that's useful to the action.
GM has veto over your description. The feature adds
+1 dice so long as the target uses it. If the GM is
particularly pleased by your description, it adds +2
dice this round and +1 dice thereafter.
I'D LIKE TO FORMALLY APOLOGISE TO EVERYONE I JUST VOMITED ON.

Describe a liquid that's useful to the action OR
detrimental to the action, your choice. GM has veto
over your description. The liquid gives +1/-1 dice if
appropriate. If the GM is particularly pleased by your
description, it gives +2/-2 dice this round and +1/-1
dice thereafter.
FUN FACT: SOME MUTANTS HAVE FLAMMABLE BLOOD
